description: This file defines the implementation of the CmasAnalyzer class, which is responsible for analyzing and logging memory resource usage, such as allocations and deallocations, within a system. It includes logging, tracking statistics, and possibly backtrace collection, indicating its role in system resource monitoring.

classes.name: CmasAnalyzer
classes.description: A class responsible for analyzing system resource (memory) usage, including tracking allocations and deallocations, logging statistics, and optionally collecting backtraces for debugging purposes.

methods.name: CmasAnalyzer::CmasAnalyzer
methods.description: Constructor that initializes the analyzer with buffer length and filename, inheriting from SysResLogger.

methods.name: CmasAnalyzer::SetFilename
methods.description: Sets the filename for logging, with optional backtrace filename suffix.

methods.name: CmasAnalyzer::Insert
methods.description: Records an allocation event with specified allocator ID, size, source file, and line number.

methods.name: CmasAnalyzer::Insert (overloaded)
methods.description: Records a deallocation event with specified deallocator ID, optional associated allocator ID, size, source file, and line number.

methods.name: CmasAnalyzer::Analyze
methods.description: Performs analysis of current memory usage statistics, updating logs and optionally capturing backtraces.

methods.name: CmasAnalyzer::LogCMAS
methods.description: Generates a detailed log report of current allocations, statistics, and resource usage.
